main_definition: To send or transfer something, such as information, signals, or diseases, from one place to another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To communicate (information, data) across a distance.
meanings_and_examples.example: The message was transmitted via email and received by the recipient within minutes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To pass on or spread an infectious disease to others.
meanings_and_examples.example: The flu virus can be easily transmitted through coughs, sneezes, or touching contaminated surfaces.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To broadcast signals, typically electromagnetic waves, for communication purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: Radio stations transmit music and news to listeners across the city via radio waves.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To send a signal or command through an electronic device or network.
meanings_and_examples.example: The security system transmitted an alert when it detected movement in the house after hours.
